(\w Îµá¼°Ï‚|strong="G1519"\w* \w Ï„Î¿á¿¦Ï„Î¿|strong="G3778"\w* \w Î³á½°Ï|strong="G1063"\w* \w ÎºÎ±á½¶|strong="G2532"\w* \w Î½ÎµÎºÏÎ¿á¿–Ï‚|strong="G3498"\w* \w Îµá½Î·Î³Î³ÎµÎ»Î¯ÏƒÎ¸Î·|strong="G2097"\w*, \w á¼µÎ½Î±|strong="G2443"\w* ÎºÏÎ¹Î¸á¿¶ÏƒÎ¹ \w Î¼á½²Î½|strong="G3303"\w* \w ÎºÎ±Ï„á½°|strong="G2596"\w* \w á¼€Î½Î¸ÏÏÏ€Î¿Ï…Ï‚|strong="G0444"\w* \w ÏƒÎ±ÏÎºÎ¯|strong="G4561"\w*, Î¶á¿¶ÏƒÎ¹ \w Î´á½²|strong="G1161"\w* \w ÎºÎ±Ï„á½°|strong="G2596"\w* \w Î˜Îµá½¸Î½|strong="G2316"\w* \w Ï€Î½ÎµÏÎ¼Î±Ï„Î¹|strong="G4151"\w*).\f + \fr 4:6 \ft [This delightful verse has given commentators no end of exercise. Verse 5 ends with â€œjudge living and deadâ€, but anyone who is dead was once alive, obviously, and the judgment will be based on what they did while alive, which is why everyone needs to be evangelized while in this life. There is no definite article with â€˜deadâ€™, either in verse 5 or 6, so Peter is referring to the ones who were evangelized in this lifeâ€”he is not saying that \+nd every\+nd*one has been or will be evangelized. Everyone will be judged, but to â€˜live according to God in spiritâ€™ one must respond adequately to the Gospel.]\f* Redeem the time
